result.execSummary:
The deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Michele Jewel Hamilton in court with attorney Daniel P Repka.  Defendant Michele Jewel Hamilton in custody.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KJB- Clerk. 140pm Resolved- DPA for 5 yrs. CT amends bond to $2500 SIBS. 1:41pm adj.

DEF MUST PAY $750 CASH TO GET OUT OF JAIL.   Not to possess or use drugs or drug paraphernalia. Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion.   Must have clean UA before release from jail.  Not to have contact with: Janis Howie or Russell Shingleton or Andrew Cook.

Defendant Michele Jewel Hamilton in court with attorney Daniel P Repka by phone.  Defendant Michele Jewel Hamilton in custody.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 1:11 pm. Atty Repka addresses ct re bond mod.  ADA opposes bond mod. CT- questions def. CT- converts to sig bond. SP to be set with counsel. Counsel to schedule with Br 1 JA.  Bond cont as modified. 1:26pm adj.
